III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Grievance procedures
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4132
Section (1) An agency shall have and follow a written grievance handling
Description procedure for residents and their families. All of the following
apply:
(a) The policy shall be provided to residents, their families, and
referring sources prior to or at admission.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The children are supposed to be allowed to file a grievance
whenever they are restrained. No one has ever allowed Youth A
to do this.
Investigation Complaint was interviewed via telephone on April 9, 2024,
and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
she has never been denied filling out a grievance but sometimes
staff have asked her why she needs one. Youth A denied ever
filing a grievance.
Case Manager, Supervisor, Staff 2, and Director of
Residential Services were interviewed face to face at the
2

facility on April 3, 2024, separately in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. All individuals interviewed stated they have
offered Youth A grievance forms, but Youth A has always declined
the grievance form.
Food Services Coordinator, Director of Outreach, and Staff 3
were interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3, 2024,
separately in collaboration with DHHS Worker. All individuals
interviewed stated they have never offered a grievance form to
Youth A and Youth A has never asked them for a grievance form
to complete.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported
providing Youth A with a grievance form to complete but Youth A
never followed through on completing the form. Staff 1 stated he
offered to help Youth A complete the grievance form, but Youth A
declined the help.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 5,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 stated she
has offered Youth A grievance forms, but Youth A has always
declined the grievance form.
Staff 5, Staff 6 were interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 5, 2024, separately in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
All individuals interviewed stated they have never offered a
grievance form to Youth A and Youth A has never asked them for
a grievance form to complete.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 5,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B reported
she filled out a grievance form but never turned it in. Youth B
denied not being allowed to file a grievance.
Quality Assurance was interviewed face to face at the facility
on April 5, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Quality
Assurance stated two youth have filed grievances since October
2023 and Youth A was not one of the youths. Quality Assurance
reported often times the youth are offered the grievance form and
either do not complete the form or never turn the form in.
Staff 7 was interviewed via Teams on April 12, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 7 stated she has offered
Youth A grievance forms, but Youth A has always declined the
grievance form.
3

Documents Reviewed:
• Grievance Log excel spreadsheet reviewed from October
2023 – April 5, 2024, did not list Youth A as one of the
youths filing a grievance.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, grievance forms were offered to Youth A but not
accepted or completed by Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth has a therapist who taunts her when she is being
restrained.
Investigation Complaint was interviewed via telephone on April 9, 2024,
and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A reported
during a restraint Therapist was saying lots of stuff to make Youth
A talk, but it was triggering her so Youth A smashed Therapist’s
head and grabbed her hair. Youth A stated Therapist was telling
Youth A she was “trying to break through me.” Youth A reported
Therapist kept wanting Youth A to talk but it was making her mad.
Youth A described later talking with Therapist and Therapist told
Youth A, “this is how you get mature; you talk about what is
bothering you.” Youth A reported these are the only comments
Therapist has made to her while Youth A was being restrained.
Youth A could not recall when, where or who was involved in the
restraint.
4

Case Manager, Food Services Coordinator, Director of
Outreach, Supervisor, Staff 1, Staff 2, Staff 3, and Director of
Residential Services were interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 3, 2024, separately in collaboration with
DHHS Worker. All individuals interviewed denied ever hearing
Therapist taunt Youth A or any youth during a restraint. None of
the individuals interviewed reported having any concerns with how
Therapist interacts with youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 5,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described
seeing Therapist talk with various youth while the youth is in a
restraint to help calm the youth or help them talk through the
situation. Staff 4 denied ever seeing Therapist taunt Youth A or
any youth.
Staff 5 and Staff 6 were interviewed face to face at the facility
on April 5, 2024, separately in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. They both denied ever seeing Therapist taunt Youth A or
any youth during a restraint. Both staff interviewed stated they did
not have any concerns with how Therapist interacts with youth.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 5,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth B described
Therapist talking with her sometimes during restraints telling
Youth B to breath through the situation. Youth B stated Therapist
uses appropriate words when talking to her during restraints and
denied Therapist ever taunting her. Youth B reported she did not
have any concerns with Therapist.
Therapist was interviewed via Teams on April 12, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Therapist described talking
with Youth A on how to improve things, how to have a conflict and
talk through things and letting Youth A know she cannot assault
people and not think staff will not restrain. Therapist described
being in a restraint with Youth A and Youth A pulling out a
significant amount of Therapist’s hair. Therapist denied taunting
Youth A during the restraint. Therapist stated she had a firm
conversation with Youth A about her actions and understanding
how her behavior leads to certain events. Therapist reported
Youth A does not make good connections on how what Youth A is
doing with her behavior that leads to certain events.
Staff 7 was interviewed via Teams on April 12, 2024, in
collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 7 denied ever seeing
Therapist taunt Youth A or any youth during a restraint. Staff 7
5

stated she did not have any concerns with how Therapist interacts
with youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Therapist’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record
and Therapist completed the required Aegis training on
11/08/2023.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per staff and youth
interviews no one reported Therapist taunting Youth A or any
youth during restraints.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention; prohibited
Title restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4159
Section (6) Restraint must not last longer than the minimal duration of time
Description it takes for a youth to calm down and to restore safety.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is always being put into restraints. According to staff, on
March 15, youth was put into restraints ten times in one day.
Staff are keeping her in these restraints for long periods of time up
to a few hours.
Investigation Complaint was interviewed via telephone on April 9, 2024,
and reported they had no further information.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A described
recently having one day where she was in multiple restraints.
Youth A stated it started by her “basically trying to jump Youth B.”
Youth A reported she was upset with Youth B because Youth B
took a wagon Youth A was using. Youth A described being in the
van with Food Service Coordinator when she saw Staff 1 pulling
Youth B in the wagon. Youth A stated Food Service Coordinator
stopped the van to talk with Staff 1 and offered to take Youth B
back to the house. Youth A reported she was upset by this and
jumped out of the van to fight Youth B. Youth A stated Youth C
was also in the van and jumped out to help fight Youth B. Youth A
stated Youth C tried to tip the wagon over with Youth B in it and
Youth A and Youth C tried to hit Youth B. Youth A described Staff
1 getting between the youths trying to stop them from fighting.
Youth A reported Staff 3 arrived and placed Youth C in a restraint
for hitting Youth B and walked her away from the fight. Youth A
6

stated she could not recall anything about Youth C being
restrained because she was trying to get pass Staff 1 to hit Youth
B. Youth B described Staff 1 standing between Youth A and
Youth B, with Youth B standing behind Staff 1. Youth A reported
she was able to reach around Staff 1, hit Youth B and grab Youth
B’s hair. Youth A stated Youth B was able to reach around Staff 1
and grab Youth A’s hair, while Staff 1 remained in between the
youths. Youth A reported Youth A, Youth B, and Staff 1 fell to the
ground. Youth A denied Staff 1 falling on top of her or Youth B.
Youth A stated Staff 1 continued to try and stop Youth A and
Youth B from punching one another by holding his hands up
between Youth A and Youth B. Youth A reported she still had
Youth B’s hair and Youth B still had a handful of Youth A’s hair.
Youth A described other staff arriving to help.
Youth A reported eventually she let go of Youth B’s hair and Staff
1 worked on trying to get Youth B to open her hand to let go of
Youth A’s hair while they were all still on the ground. Youth A
stated Staff 1 ended up pulling Youth A’s hair. Youth A reported
she was not sure if it was an accident or on purpose. Youth A
described a staff helping Youth B up and they walked away from
the situation. Youth A reported she was mad, could not control
herself or did not want to control herself so she bit Staff 1 on his
back as they both were standing up. Youth A reported she was
placed in a restraint by Staff 1. Youth A described the restraint
lasting one to two minutes. Youth A reported she agreed to calm
down and was taken to the house by a different staff. Youth A
stated when she arrived at the house Youth C was there, but
Youth B was not. Youth A reported Youth C told her she
destroyed Youth B’s bedroom and they decided to find Youth B
and beat her up. Youth A described running around looking for
Youth B and hearing Youth B was at the Career Tech Center
(CTC). Youth A stated she went to the CTC with staff following
her and found Director of Outreach and Director of Residential
Services standing outside. Youth A stated she picked up and
threw rocks at windows and Director of Outreach. She also
punched Director of Outreach. Youth A reported Director of
Outreach placed her in a restraint and Director of Residential
Services assisted. Youth A stated Case Manager arrived and
switched out with Director of Outreach. Youth A stated the
restraint was ended after she made a plan to be safe and return to
the house. Youth A denied finding Youth B at the CTC and later
learned Youth B was taken to the hospital.
Youth A described being restrained again later that night for hitting
Staff 3 while in the kitchen. Youth A reported Staff 3 was talking
7

to her about being calm for the remainder of the night and she felt
like Staff 3 had an attitude with her so she pushed and punched
Staff 3. Youth A stated Staff 3 restrained her while standing up,
she dropped her weight to the floor, so Staff 3 let her go. Youth A
described standing back up, punching Staff 3, and being
restrained by staff. Youth A reported fighting the restraint and
trying to hit Staff 3. Youth A described grabbing plates from the
kitchen and throwing them. Youth A stated the police arrived and
she talked with them and asked to press charges on Youth B.
Youth A stated the restraints lasted a minute or two and she was
not injured in the restraints.
Case Manager was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Case
Manager described responding to a staff assistance call at the
CTC. Case Manager stated she arrived at the CTC and Director
of Outreach and Director of Residential Services had Youth A in a
standing restraint. Case Manager reported she switched out
Director of Outreach because Youth A was targeting Director of
Outreach yelling at him and kicking him. Case Manager stated
Youth A was making comments about killing Youth B. Case
Manager stated she tried talking with Youth B to calm her down,
but Youth A continued to be escalated. Case Manager stated
Youth A started to turn her anger toward Case Manager, so Staff
7 switched her out. Case Manager reported Staff 7 and Director
of Residential Services continued with the restraint until Youth A
calmed down. Case Manager denied having any concerns with
the restraint.
Food Service Coordinator was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Food Service Coordinator described having Youth A and Youth C
in the van on their way back to the house from getting items to
make cookies. Food Service Coordinator stated she saw Staff 1
pulling Youth B in a wagon and stopped to check on them. Food
Service Coordinator reported Staff 1 told her Youth B’s finger was
bleeding from a hangnail, so she offered to give Youth B a ride
back to the house. Food Service Coordinator stated Youth A said
something about not wanting Youth B in the van and then Youth A
and Youth C jumped out of the van and went after Youth B. Food
Service Coordinator described Staff 1 standing in-between the
youths with his hands extended trying to create space and keep
Youth A and Youth C away from Youth B. Food Service
Coordinator reported Staff 3 arrived and was able to move Youth
C away from the situation and back to the house. Food Service
Coordinator stated Youth A and Youth B were able to reach
8

around Staff 1 and grab one another’s hair. Food Service
Coordinator reported Youth A, Staff 1, and Youth B fell to the
ground landing on their sides still pulling each other’s hair. Food
Services Coordinator stated Staff 1 was able to get up and Youth
A bit him. Food Services Coordinator denied seeing Staff 1 pull
Youth A’s hair or have concerns with how Staff 1 handled the
situation. Food Services Coordinator described seeing Youth A
be restrained later that evening in the kitchen by Staff 3. Food
Services Coordinator reported Youth A was still escalated about
Youth B and started punching Staff 3. Food Services Coordinator
stated Director of Residential Services and Staff 5 were also in the
kitchen when the restraint occurred. Food Services Coordinator
reported the restraint did not last very long and she did not have
any concerns with the restraint.
Director of Outreach was interviewed face to face at the
facility on April 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Director of Outreach described responding to a call for extra staff
and arriving to a situation with Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1.
Director of Outreach stated Youth A, Youth B and Staff 1 were on
the ground in a ditch area with Staff 1 on his back between Youth
A and Youth B. Director of Outreach reported Youth A and Youth
B had a handful of each other’s hair and was pulling it. Director of
Outreach reported he was able to get Youth B to release Youth
A’s hair, stand up and go for a walk to the CTC. Director of
Outreach stated Youth B’s hand was bleeding, so he offered to
clean her hand. Director of Outreach reported Youth A was still
yelling and threatening Youth B, so he wanted to leave the area to
help calm the situation. Director of Outreach denied seeing Staff
1 pull Youth A’s hair.
Director of Outreach reported Youth A came to the CTC throwing
rocks at windows because she believed Youth B was inside the
building. Director of Outreach stated he tried to talk with Youth A,
but she was escalated and began to throw rocks at him. Director
of Outreach reported Youth A picked up a softball size rock and
swung at him, so he placed her in a hold. Director of Outreach
described Director of Residential Services assisted with the
restraint. Director of Outreach stated Youth A was fighting the
restraint and directing her anger toward him, so Case Manager
switched him out. Director of Outreach reported Youth A started
to direct her anger toward Case Manager, so Staff 7 switched with
Case Manager and continued the hold with Director of Residential
Services. Director of Outreach stated this was the only restraint
he was in with Youth A. Director of Outreach denied having any
concerns with how staff did the restraint or the restraint lasting for
9

hours. Director of Outreach stated Youth A was very escalated
and it took her some time to calm down and be released from the
restraint.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
Youth A using a wagon earlier in the day and leaving it in the
ditch. Staff 1 stated he was getting ready to pull Youth B on the
wagon when Youth A told them it was her wagon, and they could
not use it. Staff 1 reported he talked with Youth A about the
wagon and told her she had not been using it so continued to walk
pulling Youth B on the wagon. Staff 1 stated on the way back to
the house Food Service Coordinator was driving by and stopped
to check on them. Staff 1 reported Youth A and Youth C were in
the van. Staff 1 stated Food Service Coordinator offered to give
Youth B a ride back to the house when Youth A yelled and said
Youth B was not allowed in the van. Staff 1 described Youth A
and Youth C jumped out of the van, tried tipping over the wagon
Youth B was sitting in and assault Youth B. Staff 1 reported he
got in-between the youths holding his hands out to create space.
Staff 1 stated Youth A and Youth C were going after Youth B
throwing punches over and under his arms while Youth B was
trying to fight back doing the same thing. Staff 1 described Staff 3
arriving to assist and escorting Youth C away from the situation.
Staff 1 stated Youth A and Youth B continued to try to punch one
another and eventually grabbed each other’s hair all while he
continued to be between them.
Staff 1 stated with all the struggling Youth A, Youth B, and himself
fell to the ground, landing on their sides. Staff 1 denied landing on
either Youth A or Youth B but stated the youth still had each
other’s hair. Staff 1 reported Staff 2 helped get the youths to
release each other’s hair from their grasp and was able to help
Youth B to stand up. Staff 1 stated Director of Outreach was also
present and was talking with Youth B asking her to go for a walk
away from the situation. Staff 1 stated when he went to stand up
Youth A bit him and continued to try and reach Youth B. Staff 1
reported he placed Youth A in a standing restraint. Staff 1 stated
the restraint did not last long and Staff 2 walked Youth A back to
the house. Staff 1 reported he walked to the CTC with Director of
Outreach and Youth B. Staff 1 denied ever pulling Youth A’s hair
but stated when they landed on the ground, he may have had
some of her long hair under his arm and when they were all
moving around Youth A’s hair may have been pulled. Staff 1
reported he sat with Youth B debriefing the situation and helping
her deescalate. Staff 1 stated Youth B was taken to the hospital
10

for the scratches on her face. Staff 1 denied being involved in any
other restraints that day with Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
responding to an extra staff call and seeing Staff 1 on the ground
between Youth A and Youth B who were fighting and pulling each
other’s hair. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 was walking with Youth C
back to the house. Staff 2 stated she worked on getting Youth A’s
hand out of Youth B’s hair and Youth B released Youth A’s hair.
Staff 2 stated Youth B stood up but was still escalated and
threatening Youth A. Staff 2 reported she placed Youth B in a
restraint because she was afraid Youth B was going to continue to
go after Youth A. Staff 2 described making a plan with Youth B
and Youth B agreed to be calm and walk away from the situation
when released. Staff 2 stated Youth B was released and walked
toward the CTC. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 went to stand up and
while getting up Youth A bit him on the back. Staff 2 described
Youth A continuing to threaten Youth B and go after her so Staff 1
placed Youth A into a restraint. Staff 2 described Youth A calming
down and agreeing to return to the house so Staff 1 released
Youth A. Staff 2 denied seeing Staff 1 pull Youth A’s hair at any
time. Staff 2 stated she only saw Youth B pull Youth A’s hair.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 3,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 described
responding to an additional staff call and arriving to see Staff 1
standing between Youth A, Youth C, and Youth B. Staff 3 stated
all three youths were trying to get to one another and Youth C was
able to get around Staff 1 and hit Youth B. Staff 3 stated he
placed Youth C in a restraint, she agreed to walk back to the
house, so he let her go and they walked back to the house. Staff
3 reported that was his only involvement in that situation. Staff 3
described being involved in restraints in the kitchen with Youth A
later that evening. Staff 3 described talking with Youth A about
her plan in the house when she became escalated, walked into
the kitchen, and began throwing dishes. Staff 3 reported he tried
using proximity to move her from the kitchen and she started
punching him. Staff 3 described placing Youth A in a restraint,
she dropped her weight to the ground, and he released her from
the restraint. Staff 3 stated Youth A stood up and started swinging
at him, hitting him in the face so he restrained her again. Staff 3
reported he was having a difficult time holding onto Youth A
because she was fighting the restraint, so Staff 5 attempted to
help. Staff 3 reported Director of Residential Services was in the
house and stepped in to relieve Staff 5. Staff 3 described Youth A
11

dropping her weight to the ground again, so the restraint was
disengaged. Staff 3 reported Youth A then got up and ran down
the hall toward her bedroom. Staff 3 stated the police arrived and
talked with staff and youth. Staff 3 denied any other restraint
occurring that evening. Staff 3 reported the restraints in the
kitchen did not last long because as soon as Youth A dropped her
weight to the ground the restraint was disengaged. Staff 3 stated
he believed the longest restraint was about seven minutes. Staff
3 described Youth A still being upset about the situation earlier
with Youth B and was having a difficult time deescalating.
Director of Residential Services was interviewed face to face
at the facility on April 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS
Worker. Director of Residential Services described being
involved in two restraints with Youth A. The first restraint was at
the CTC assisting Director of Outreach and the other at the house
in the kitchen. Director of Residential Services stated he saw
Youth A punching Director of Outreach and Director of Outreach
initiated a restraint. Director of Residential Services reported he
assisted in a two-person restraint. Director of Residential
Services described Youth A as kicking and directing her anger
toward Director of Outreach, so Case Manager switched out
Director of Outreach. Director of Residential Services reported
Youth A then started to direct her anger at Case Manager, so Staff
7 switched out Case Manager. Director of Residential Services
described making a plan with Youth A to return to the house and
Youth A returning to the house with Staff 7.
Director of Residential Services described later in the evening
Youth A continued to be escalated at the house. Director of
Residential Services stated he was at the house and witnessed
Youth A punch Staff 3 in the face. Director reported Youth A was
in a few restraints because she would drop her weight to the
ground, get back up and assault staff then be restrained again.
Director of Residential Services reported Youth A punched Staff 3,
Staff 3 initiated a restraint with Staff 5’s assistance. Director of
Residential Services reported Staff 5 was unable to control Youth
A’s arm and got hit in the process. Director of Residential
Services described Staff 6 gaining control of Youth A’s arm and
assisting Staff 3 and Youth A dropping her weight to the ground so
Staff 3 and Staff 6 released. Director of Residential Services
reported Youth A got up and hit Staff 3, so Director of Residential
Services assisted, and Youth A was placed in another restraint.
Director of Residential Services stated Staff 3 and he could not
get a proper hold of Youth A, so they released, and Youth A ran to
her room. Director of Residential Services stated Youth A was in
12

a few restraints that night due to Youth A dropping her weight,
staff releasing, then reengaging when Youth A got up and
continued punching staff.
Staff 5 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 5,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 5 described
coming on shift and seeing Youth A in the kitchen, breaking
dishes, and yelling at staff. Staff 5 stated Youth A swung at Staff
3 and was placed in a level one restraint. Staff 5 reported Youth A
dropped her weight so Staff 3 released, Youth A stood up and
again started punching Staff 3. Staff 5 stated she attempted to
restraint Youth A but was unable to secure Youth A’s arm. Staff 5
reported Youth A hit Staff 5, knocking her glasses off, then
Director of Residential Services took over the restraint. Staff 5
described law enforcement showing up and Youth A started to
calm down.
Staff 6 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 5,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 6 described
Youth A being in three restraints in the kitchen recently. Staff 6
reported the first restraint was a benevolent restraint when Youth
A went after Staff 3, the second restraint was when Youth A
punched Staff 5 knocking Staff 5’s glasses off, and the third
restraint was a level three done by Director of Residential
Services. Staff 6 described Youth A as being very escalated,
physically assaulting staff, and fighting to get out of the restraints.
Staff 6 stated she did not have any concerns with the restraints.
Staff 7 was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 12,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 7 described
being in the kitchen area trying to keep Youth C away from Youth
A who was escalated and throwing dishes. Staff 7 stated she saw
Youth A attempt to punch Staff 3 and be placed in a restraint by
Staff 3. Staff 7 reported she was able to get Youth C out of the
area and did not see any more of the situation.
Attempts to interview Youth C occurred on April 23 and April
30, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. A phone
message was left by DHHS Worker on April 23, 2024, requesting
to schedule a Teams interview with Youth C with no return phone
call. A Teams interview was scheduled and confirmed to occur on
April 30, 2024, but Youth C did not join the Teams meeting. A
phone call was made while waiting on Teams for Youth C to join
and a message was left with no return call.
13

Video Reviewed:
There is no camera in the area where the restraint took place
outside the CTC or in the driveway/ditch area.
Video footage of March 15, 2024, in the kitchen was reviewed on
April 3, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth A is seen
in the kitchen/living area pacing around the room. Staff 3 follows
Youth A into the kitchen and Youth A punches Staff 3 and is
placed in a restraint by Staff 3. Youth C is also in the area and
approaches Youth A in the kitchen. While in the restraint Youth A
is moved out of the kitchen area, Youth A drops her weight, Staff 3
releases. The restraint lasts approximately one minute.
Youth A and Staff 3 enter the kitchen and Youth A punches Staff 3
and is placed in a restraint by Staff 3 and Staff 5. Youth A is
kicking and fighting the restraint. Staff 5 appears to be adjusting
her hold while Staff 3 is trying to maintain the hold. Youth A drops
to the ground and the restraint is ended. This restraint lasts
approximately two minutes. Youth C is seen trying to get to Youth
A while Director of Residential Services and Staff 7 stand in-
between the youths keeping them apart.
Youth A enters the kitchen with Staff 3 following and attempts to
punch Staff 3. Staff 3 is seen struggling to get ahold of Youth A’s
